page.title: 10Hitchman Builders
page.content: Hitchman is a building contractors owned by Mr.C. Franklin who lives in Gardeners Cottage, Woolton Hill.The company was established in 1880.It is a family business and they employ seventy people.The company used to be undertakers.One of the first buildings they constructed was The Clocktower in Newbury.In 1985 they construct: Primary schools,Flats,Cottages and rest homes.Each building takes about seven months to build.The materials they use are:bricks, concrete, stone, timber, tiles, fibre glass, plastic, plaster and glass.They lay about a thousand bricks a day.They built the museum in Newbury.Some of the work They have undertacken is Calcot Place, Phoenix House, Buckell and Ballard,and Bartlett's Farm.
